#Introducing the domain of the tiling functions

== Exploring Tiling Space ==

To generate all possible tiling for a base screen use the following method. Considering the run-time performance all code here is implemented in Java instead of R (though we do provide an [http://www.r-project.org/ R] version).


||*Tiling Style*||*Method*||
||rectangle|| <code language="java"> public void generateRectangleTiling(int column, int row, File neighborfile, File outdir) </code>||
||diamond|| <code language="java"> public void generateDiamondTiling(int u, int v, File neighborfile, File outdir)</code>||
||hexagon|| <code language="java"> public void generateHexagonTiling(double u, File neighborfile, File outdir)</code>||
||ellipse|| <code language="java"> public void generateEllipseTiling(int u, File neighborfile, File outdir)</code>||

It requires the tiling parameters and a neighbor file indicating the adjacent tiles for each tiles.

== Example ==
For example we want to generate all tiling functions for the diamond (ellipse=1) base screen.
[http://learning2tile.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/1_ellipse_id.png]
